page.title: 04Farms
page.content: We have a lot of farms in our block. Most of them are dairy cows and crops. Crofts is quite a big dairy farm owned by Mr Henry. He keeps pigs too and has some crops like barley and silage. Nearly every farm has silage. Mr Milligan owns a big farm called Culvennan. It is a big dairy farm with a lot of technology in evidence. Mr Milligan has won more silage competitions than any other farmer in Scotland. Mr Henry owns Crofts which is quite big. Mr Johnstone owns Bridgestone. It is smaller than Culvennan and has cattle and silage. Mr Martin owns Camp Douglas, which is fairly small. It has some dairy cattle and silage. Mr Neil owns Boat Croft. It is just a house. Mr McWilliam owns Marchfield Farm. He does Bed & Breakfast at Â£7.00 a night.
